abstract: Dr Charles H Townes, Nobel Prize-winning physicist whose research led to development of lasers, ushering in technological revolution that has affected all aspects of modern life, dies at age 99; worked as researcher, teacher and adviser to presidents, schools and labs during his productive six-decade career.
lead_paragraph: Dr. Townes shared the Nobel Prize in 1964 for his work on lasers, in a career that included advising on lunar landings, verifying Einstein’s theories and creating an atomic clock.
snippet: Dr. Townes shared the Nobel Prize in 1964 for his work on lasers, in a career that included advising on lunar landings, verifying Einstein’s theories and creating an atomic clock.

keywords.value: Laser (Light Amplification by Stimulated Emission of Radiation)
keywords.name: subject

headline.main: Charles H. Townes, Who Paved Way for the Laser in Daily Life, Dies at 99
headline.print_headline: Charles H. Townes, Laser Pioneer, Dies
